newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hotel Nikko Hong Kong sets HK$900 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Hotel Nikko Hong Kong sets HK$900 mln loan.

text.p: A HK$900 million term loan facility for Hotel Nikko Hong Kong Ltd will be completed as a club deal, bankers said.
They said the loan will have a cash deficiency guarantee provided by CDL Hotels International Ltd and Asean Resources Holdings Ltd.

The loan carries a maturity of seven years and has an average life of 4.05 years. It will pay a margin of 68 basis points over the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate for the first three years and 80 basis points over HIBOR thereafter.
Repayment of the loan will be in 14 semi-annual instalments after six months' grace period.
Proceeds of the loan will be used for refinancing a previous deal.
Bankers said the loan has been fully underwritten by the arrangers Societe Generale Asia and Sakura Bank Hong Kong.
